content.name: section_3
content.title: Liquid chromatography (LC) Equipment - Column: Product details

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.column_manufacturer
fields.label: Column manufacturer
fields.help: The name of the column manufacturer.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.column_model
fields.label: Column model
fields.help: The model of the column.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.separation_mode
fields.label: Separation mode
fields.help: A description of the type of column being used. (e.g., Separation mechanism: Affinity, Anion Exchange, Cation Exchange, Reverse Phase, Hydrodynamic Volume).

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.dimensions
fields.label: Dimensions
fields.help: The dimensions of the column in terms of length and inner diameter or the total volume of the column where this value is appropriate, for example to describe gel filtration experiments.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.description_of_stationary_phase
fields.label: Description of stationary phase
fields.help: A description of the constituents of the stationary phase, including the name of the packing material and the particle size, or describe packing materials in the case of monoliths including their manufacturer if stationary phase obtained separately from column.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.additional_accessories
fields.label: Additional accessories
fields.help: Details of any guards or traps used in conjunction with the column.

content.name: section_4
content.title: LC Equipment - Chromatography system used for separation

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.combined_unit_manufacturer
fields.label: Manufacturer of combined unit and software
fields.help: The name of the manufacturer of combined unit or component parts including software used to operate.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.combined_unit_model
fields.label: Model (of combined unit)
fields.help: The model name provided by the manufacturer.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.mobile_phases
fields.label: Mobile phase
fields.help: Describe all the mobile phases of the run. Including the name used to refer the mobile phase in the Column Run properties and, for each constituent, a description, the concentration, pH (and how adjusted) and date of preparation.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.time
fields.label: Time
fields.help: The total time of the Column Run with appropriate units.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.gradient
fields.label: Gradient
fields.help: The proportion of each of the mobile phases, relative to time , for the function describing the gradient, including its overall duration. There may be several steps that together make up the gradient

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.flow_rate
fields.label: Flow rate
fields.help: The flow rate at which the mobile phase is applied to the column, including the time period for which this holds if it varies during the experiment.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.temperature
fields.label: Temperature
fields.help: The temperature at which the column is run, including the time period for which this holds if it varies during the experiment.

content.name: section_7
content.title: LC - Pre and Post Run processes

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.pre_run_process_type
fields.label: Type
fields.help: A description of the purpose of the process, such as equilibration, calibration or washing (this may be part of the column run, as one step or as a preconditioning of the column prior to use).

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.pre_run_process_substance
fields.label: Substance
fields.help: A description of the reagent used in the process.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.pre_run_process_time
fields.label: Time
fields.help: The duration of the process.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.pre_run_process_flowrate
fields.label: Flow rate
fields.help: The rate at which the mobile phase is applied to the column.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.detection_equipment
fields.label: Equipment used for detection
fields.help: Manufacturer and model, or description.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.detection_type
fields.label: Type
fields.help: A description of the kind of detector (e.g. UV, MS).

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.detection_equipment_settings
fields.label: Equipment settings
fields.help: A description of control properties of the detector, such as the wavelength that is being detected.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.detection_timescale
fields.label: Timescale over which data was collected
fields.help: The time range covered by the trace produced by the detector.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.detection_trace
fields.label: Trace
fields.help: The location and format of the trace if appropriate.

fields.name: extractionMethod.separationMethod.fractions
fields.label: Fraction
fields.help: Describe all the fractions of the run (if separation purpose is preparative). Include a name, unique within a run, by which a fraction can be referenced, and ither a description of the procedure by which the fractions were collected i.e. start/end time, size (time or volume), mode (fixed or peak directed), or a description of the individual fractions (e.g. time of collection, volume).

fields.name: extractionMethod.mass_spectrometer_manufacturer
fields.label: Mass spectrometer manufacturer
fields.help: The manufacturing company for the mass spectrometer.

fields.name: extractionMethod.mass_spectrometer_model
fields.label: Mass spectrometer model
fields.help: The manufacturing model name for the mass spectrometer.

fields.name: extractionMethod.customizations
fields.label: Customizations (summary)
fields.help: Any significant (i.e. affecting behaviour) deviations from the manufacturer’s specification for the mass spectrometer.

fields.name: extractionMethod.ionization_source
fields.label: Ionization source
fields.help: Choose the Ion source

fields.name: extractionMethod.supply_type
fields.label: Supply type
fields.help: Whether the sprayer is fed by, for example, chromatography or CE or is loaded with sample once before spraying, such as in static infusion

fields.name: extractionMethod.interface_manufacturer_and_model
fields.label: Interface details
fields.help: The manufacturing company and model name for the interface; list any modifications made to the standard specification. If the interface is entirely custom-built, describe it or provide a reference if available.

fields.name: extractionMethod.sprayer_type_manufacturer_and_model
fields.label: Spayer details
fields.help: The manufacturing company and model name for the sprayer; list any modifications made to the standard specification. If the sprayer is entirely custom-built, describe it briefly or provide a reference if available.

fields.name: extractionMethod.other_electrospray_ionisation
fields.label: Other details
fields.help: Where appropriate, and if considered as discriminating elements of the source parameters, describe these values.

fields.name: extractionMethod.plate_composition
fields.label: Plate composition
fields.help: The material of which the target plate is made (usually stainless steel, or coated glass); if the plate has a special construction then that should be briefly described and catalogue and lot numbers given where available.

fields.name: extractionMethod.matrix_composition
fields.label: Matrix composition
fields.help: The material in which the sample is embedded on the target (e.g. alpha-cyano-4-hydroxycinnamic acid).

fields.name: extractionMethod.psd_summary
fields.label: PSD summary
fields.help: Confirm whether post-source decay, laser-induced decomposition, or in-source dissociation was performed; if so provide a brief description of the process (for example, summarize the stepwise reduction of reflector voltage).

fields.name: extractionMethod.laser_type_and_wavelength
fields.label: Laser details
fields.help: The type of laser and the wavelength (nm) of the generated pulse. For instance nitrogen, 337 nm.

fields.name: extractionMethod.other_maldi
fields.label: Other details
fields.help: Other details of the laser used to shoot at the matrix-embedded sample if considered important for the interpretation of data; this might include the pulse energy, focus diameter, attenuation details, pulse duration at full-width half maximum, frequency of shots in Hertz and average number of shots fired to generate each combined mass spectrum.

fields.name: extractionMethod.other_ionization_description
fields.label: Ion source description
fields.help: Describe the ion source and provide relevant and discriminating parameters for its use.

fields.name: extractionMethod.mass_analyzer_type
fields.label: Analyzer description
fields.help: Describe the analyzer(s) used in the MS experiment. Example might be MS1 survey scans in an Orbitrap and MSn analysed in a linear trap

fields.name: extractionMethod.reflectron_status
fields.label: Time-of-Flight drift tube: Reflectron status
fields.help: Time-of-Flight drift tube: Reflectron status (on, off, none) when status can be set.

fields.name: extractionMethod.activation_location
fields.label: Instrument component where the activation / dissociation occurs
fields.help: The hardware element where activation and/or dissociation occurs. For instance a quadrupole collision cell, a 3D ion trap, the ion source (for ISD, PSD, LID, isCID)

fields.name: extractionMethod.gas_type
fields.label: Gas type
fields.help: The composition and pressure of the gas used to fragment ions, for instance in the collision cell.

fields.name: extractionMethod.activation_type
fields.label: Activation / dissociation type
fields.help: The type of activation and/or dissociation used in the fragmentation process. Examples might include Collision Induced Dissociation (CID) with a static or spread collision energy, Electron Transfer Dissociaton (ETD) with provided activator molecules.

content.name: section_12
content.title: MS - Spectrum and peak list generation and annotation (data acquisition)

fields.name: extractionMethod.acquisition_software
fields.label: Software and version
fields.help: The instrument management and data analysis package name and version; where there are several pieces of software involved, give name, version and role for each of them. Mention also upgrades not reflected in the version number.

fields.name: extractionMethod.acquisition_parameters
fields.label: Acquisition parameters
fields.help: The information on how the MS data have been generated. It describes the instrument’s parameter settings / acquisition method file or information describing the acquisition conditions and settings of the MS run. Ideally this should be a URI+filename, for example an export of the acquisition method (and Tune page or other relevant information where appropriate). This includes for instance if the data are acquired and primarily stored in a profile or centroid mode. An explicit text description of the acquisition process is also desirable. This includes the acquisition sequence (for instance as simplified as top-five method with a cycle made of one full MS1 scan in the Orbitrap, followed by a precursor selection of 5 most intense ions applying an exclusion window of 30 seconds and followed by the acquisition of 5 product ion scans generated in the LTQ analyzer, and detected in the LTQ). This allows to differentiate between the use of a selected precursor window vs unselected fragmentation (MS`E/bbCID/AIF). This also allows to explicitly describe pre-defined the acquisition method of a SRM experiment where all transitions and detection windows are specified.

content.name: section_13
content.title: MS - Spectrum and peak list generation and annotation (resulting data)

fields.label: Location of source (‘raw’) and processed files
fields.help: The technology used to produce the raw data (e.g. RNA-seq).

fields.name: extractionMethod.intensity_values
fields.label: m/z and intensity values
fields.help: The actual data (m/z and intensity) for each spectrum. This is most often provided in the spectra and/or peaklist file.

fields.name: extractionMethod.ms_level
fields.label: MS level
fields.help: The MS level (e.g. MS^2) at which each spectrum was acquired. This is most often provided in the spectra or peaklist file.

fields.name: extractionMethod.ion_mode
fields.label: Ion mode
fields.help: The ion mode (positive or negative). This is most often provided in the spectra or peaklist file.

fields.name: extractionMethod.additional_info
fields.label: Additional information for MS level 2
fields.help: For tandem spectra; in addition to the preceding information,the precursor m/z value and the charge state of the precursor ion should be given; the mass spectrum used to deduce the precursor information should also be provided.
